title: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds
text: package provides functions analysis clinical drug-drug interaction (DDI) risk per relevant FDA EMA guidelines.

title: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds
text: can install development version ddir using:
code: devtools::install_github("rstrotmann/ddir")

title: Assessment of the clinical DDI risk for drug compounds
text: package provides sample data fictional drug, examplinib. following code calculates perpetrator DDI risk direct CYP inhibition (basic method) provides markdown-formatted output table: See also: kinetic_cyp_induction_risk_table(), mech_stat_cyp_risk_table(), basic_ugt_inhibition_risk_table(), transporter_inhibition_risk_table() Full documentation can found github.
code: library(ddir)  p <- examplinib_compounds[[1]] property_table(p) basic_cyp_inhibition_risk_table(p, examplinib_cyp_inhibition_data)

text: perp perpetrator object. cyp_inh CYP inhibition data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' name perpetrator compound. 'cyp' CYP enzyme (upper case) character. 'ki' \(k_i\) \(\mu M\) numeric. 'source' Optional source information character.

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: data frame.

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: basic modeling direct (reversible) CYP enzyme inhibition, ratio relevant inhibitor concentration \(K_i\) respective CYP enzyme considered, .e., \(R_1\) hepatic enzymes \(R_{1,gut}\) intestinal enzymes (refer fig. 1  FDA guidance).

title: Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
Basic CYP inhibition risk — basic_cyp_inhibition_risk
text: $$R_{1,gut}=1+\frac{I_{gut}}{K_{,u}}$$ \(R_1\) values > 1.02, .e., maximal unbound perpetrator concentrations 50-fold \(K_i\) considered indicate clinical risk using method. Note section 5.3.3.1 EMA DDI guidance defines relevant ratio \(R_1=\frac{I_{max,ss,u}}{K_{,u}}\) threshold 0.02. output, columns risk_hep risk_intest indicate whether regulatory threshold reached respecive enzyme. Refer documentation key_concentrations() function details calculation \(I_{max,ss,u}\) \(I_{gut}\).

what: Basic modeling of the CYP time-dependent inhibition risk — basic_cyp_tdi_risk
title: Basic modeling of the CYP time-dependent inhibition risk — basic_cyp_tdi_risk
text: function calculates risk time-dependent inhibition CYP enzymes.

title: Basic modeling of the CYP time-dependent inhibition risk — basic_cyp_tdi_risk
code: basic_cyp_tdi_risk(perp, tdi, cyp_kdeg = cyp_turnover)

title: Basic modeling of the CYP time-dependent inhibition risk — basic_cyp_tdi_risk
text: perp perpetrator object. tdi CYP TDI data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' perpetrator compound name character. 'cyp' CYP enzyme character. 'ki' \(K_I\) µM numeric. 'kinact' \(k_{inact}\) 1/h numeric. 'source' Optional source information character, cyp_kdeg CYP turnover data data frame. Defaults built-reference data, cyp_turnover.

title: Basic modeling of the CYP time-dependent inhibition risk — basic_cyp_tdi_risk
text: data frame.

title: Basic modeling of the CYP time-dependent inhibition risk — basic_cyp_tdi_risk
text: relevant metric \(R_2\) defined fig. 2 FDA guidance: $$R_2=\frac {k_{obs} + k_{deg}}{k_{deg}}$$ $$k_{obs}=\frac {50*k_{inact}*I_{max,u}}{K_{,u} + 50*I_{max,u}}$$ Values \(R_2 > 1.25\) suggest relevant TDI potential. CYP degradation rates, \(k_{deg}\) physiological constants derived scientific literature. package provides standard values \(k_{deg}\) cyp_turnover commonly used. present version, risk hepatic TDI CYP enzymes calculated.

title: Basic modeling of the CYP time-dependent inhibition risk — basic_cyp_tdi_risk
code: basic_cyp_tdi_risk(examplinib_parent, examplinib_cyp_tdi_data) #>      cyp   ki    fu kinact   kdeg    source       r2 risk #> 1 CYP3A4 0.17 0.023   0.04 0.0193 study 001 3.071556 TRUE

code: basic_ugt_inhibition_risk(perp, ugt_inh)

title: UGT inhibition risk — basic_ugt_inhibition_risk
text: perp perpetrator object. ugt_inh UGT inhibition data data frame, following fields expected: 'name' name perpetrator compound. 'ugt' UGT enzyme (upper case) character. 'ic50' \(IC_{50}\) \(\mu M\) numeric. 'source' Optional source information character.

title: UGT inhibition risk — basic_ugt_inhibition_risk
text: markdown-formatted table.

title: UGT inhibition risk — basic_ugt_inhibition_risk
text: function assumes UGT inhibition data provided \(IC_{50}\). According Cheng, Prusoff 1973), \(K_i\) can assumed \(IC_{50}/2\) experimental conditions commonly used vitro ihibition studies substrate concentrations close \(K_M\). relevant metric basic modeling UGT inhibition risk \(R_1=I_{max,ss,u}/K_{,u}\) (refer fig. 1  FDA guidance). \(R_1>1.02\) considered indicate potential UGT inhibition risk. Refer documentation key_concentrations() function details calculation \(I_{max,ss,u}\).

title: Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
text: Key perpetrator concentrations uM (default) ng/ml named vector.

title: Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
text: $$I_{gut} = \frac{D} {250}$$ exceeds aqueous solubility drug, \(I_{gut}\) set solubility.

title: Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
text: $$I_{max,ss,u}=I_{max,ss} * f_u$$

title: Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
text: orally administered (parent) compounds, hepatic inlet concentration systemic concentration plus portal term: $$portal\ term = D*\frac{F_a*F_g*k_a}{Q_h*R_B}*1000\ ng/ml$$ \(D\) administered dose mg, \(F_a\) fraction absorbed oral administration, \(F_g\) fraction available gut metabolism, \(k_a\) absorption rate, \(Q_h\) hepatic blood flow \(R_B\) blood--plasma ratio. relevant hepatic inlet concentration (\(I_{max,inlet,u}\), also called \(I_h\) mechanistic static modeling equations) concentration sum maximal systemic plasma concentration portal contribution: $$I_{max,inlet,u}=(I_{max,ss} + portal\ term) * f_u$$

title: Key perpetrator concentrations — key_concentrations
text: orally administered (parent) compounds, villous concentration gut (\(I_{enteric}\), also called \(I_g\) mechanistic static modeling equations) calculated : $$I_{enteric,u} = D * \frac{F_a*k_a}{Q_{ent}} *1000\ ng/ml$$ \(F_a\) fraction absorbed oral administration, \(k_a\) absorption rate, \(Q_{ent}\) enteric villous blood flow \(R_B\) blood--plasma distribution ratio compound. Note per FDA guideline (refer FDA, 2020, Fig. 7, Rostami-Hodjegan Tucker, 2004) blood--plasma ratio plasma binding drug ignored.

title: Basic kinetic CYP induction risk — kinetic_cyp_induction_risk
text: perp perpetrator object. cyp_ind CYP induction data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' name perpetrator compound character. 'cyp' CYP enzyme (upper case) character. 'emax' \(E_{max}\), .e., maximum induction effect determined vitro numeric. 'ec50' \(EC_{50}\) µM numeric. 'maxc' maximal concentration µM tested vitro assay numeric. 'source' Optional source information character. d Scaling factor, defaults 1.

title: Basic kinetic CYP induction risk — kinetic_cyp_induction_risk
text: data frame.

title: Basic kinetic CYP induction risk — kinetic_cyp_induction_risk
text: Basic kinetic modeling CYP induction risk considers \(R_3\) (refer fig. 4 FDA guideline): $$R_3 = \frac {1}{1+d* \frac {E_{max}*10*I_{max,u}}{EC_{50} + 10*I_{max,u}}}$$ \(d\) scaling factor standard value 1. different value can used warranted prior experience experimental setup. \(R_3 \le 0.8\) suggests relevant vivo induction potential.

title: Basic kinetic CYP induction risk — kinetic_cyp_induction_risk
code: kinetic_cyp_induction_risk(examplinib_parent, examplinib_cyp_induction_data) #>       cyp emax ec50 maxc    source        r3 risk #> 1  CYP1A2 1.00   NA    5 study 007        NA   NA #> 2  CYP2B6 1.00   NA    5 study 007        NA   NA #> 3  CYP2C8   NA   NA   NA                  NA   NA #> 4  CYP2C9   NA   NA   NA                  NA   NA #> 5 CYP2C19   NA   NA   NA                  NA   NA #> 6  CYP2D6   NA   NA   NA                  NA   NA #> 7  CYP3A4 7.35 1.64    3 study 007 0.2134856 TRUE

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: perp perpetrator object. cyp_inh CYP inhibition data data frame, see basic_cyp_inhibition_risk details. cyp_ind CYP induction data data frame. See kinetic_cyp_induction_risk details. cyp_tdi CYP TDI data data frame. See basic_cyp_tdi_risk details. d Induction scaling factor, defaults 1. include_induction Switch define whether induction effects included calculation (C-terms per FDA guideline) substr CYP probe substrates used data frame, defaults cyp_reference_substrates. data frame expected following fields: 'cyp' CYP enzyme (upper case) character. 'substrate' substrate name character. 'fgut' fraction drug escaping gut metabolism. 'fm' fraction drug undergoes hepatic metabolism. 'fmcyp' fraction metabolized respective CYP enzyme. kdeg CYP turnover data data frame. Defaults built-reference data, cyp_turnover

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: data frame.

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: approach, AUC ratios probe substrates calculated based known intestinal hepatic metabolism. direct (competitive) time-dependent inhibition considered. formula given FDA guideline (refer fig. 7 FDA, 2020) also includes intestinal hepatic enzyme induction terms (\(C_g\) \(C_h\), respectively). time, guideline states inhibition induction considered separately. $$AUCR = \frac{1}{A_g*B_g*C_g* \left(1-F_g \right)+F_g} * \frac{1}{A_h*B_h*C_h*f_m+\left(1-f_m\right)}$$ individual terms :

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: $$A_g = \frac{1}{1+\frac{I_g}{K_i}}$$ $$A_h = \frac{1}{1+\frac{I_h}{K_i}}$$

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: $$B_g = \frac{k_{deg,g}}{k_{deg,g} + \frac{I_g*k_{inact}}{I_g+K_I}}$$ $$B_h = \frac{k_{deg,h}}{k_{deg,h} + \frac{I_h*k_{inact}}{I_h+K_I}}$$

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk
text: $$C_g = 1 + \frac{d*E_{max}*I_g}{I_g+EC_{50}}$$ $$C_h = 1 + \frac{d*E_{max}*I_h}{I_h+EC_{50}}$$ hepatic inlet concentration \(I_h=I_{max,inlet,u}\) intestinal concentration \(I_g=I_{enteric,u}\), see key_concentrations(). \(d\) scaling factor CYP induction term standard value 1. different value can used warranted prior experience experimental setup.

title: CYP perpetration risk as per mechanistic-static modeling — mech_stat_cyp_risk

title: Read perpetrator information from file or text string — read_perpetrators
text: file expected comply following: Comments start '#' go end line lines format: drug, parameter, value, source fields within line comma-separated fields plain text without enclosing "" source field reference usually refers clinical non-clinical study report. source field may remain empty. Note line ends comma. metabolites, fields dose, fa, fg ka relevant filled NA. metabolites, 'oral' must 'FALSE'. Note multiple compounds, e.g., parent metabolites may included perpetrator file. typical compound file look e.g., like :
code: # name, param, value, source   # parent    examplinib,  oral,     TRUE,   examplinib,  mw,       492.6,   examplinib,  dose,     450,       clinical dose   examplinib,  imaxss,   3530,      study 001   examplinib,  fu,       0.023,     study 002   examplinib,  fumic,    1,         default   examplinib,  rb,       1,         study 003   examplinib,  fa,       0.81,      study 003   examplinib,  fg,       1,         default   examplinib,  ka,       0.00267,   unknown    # metabolite    M1,  oral,   FALSE,   M1,  mw,     506.56,   M1,  dose,   NA,   M1,  imaxss, 1038,      study 001   M1,  fu,     0.012,     study 002   M1,  fumic,  1,         default   M1,  rb,     1,         study 002   M1,  fa,     NA,   M1,  fg,     NA,   M1,  ka,     NA,

title: Read UGT inhibition data — read_ugt_inhibitor_data
text: following, comma-separated fields expected input: 'name' perpetrator compound name 'ugt' UGT enzyme (upper case) character. 'ic50' \(IC_{50}\) 'source' Optional source information character. Lines starting '#' considered comments evaluated. following example valid input:
code: # PARENT # compound, enzyme, IC50, source examplinib, UGT1A1, 15, study 009 examplinib, UGT1A3, 15, study 009 examplinib, UGT1A4, 15, study 009 examplinib, UGT1A6, 15, study 009 examplinib, UGT1A9, 3.8, study 009 examplinib, UGT2B7, 15, study 009 examplinib, UGT2B15, 15, study 009 examplinib, UGT2B17, 6.1, study 009 # METABOLITE # compound, enzyme, IC50, source M1, UGT1A1, 1.1, study 009 M1, UGT1A3, 5.8, study 009 M1, UGT1A4, 6.2, study 009 M1, UGT1A6, 15, study 009 M1, UGT1A9, 3.6, study 009 M1, UGT2B7, 15, study 009 M1, UGT2B15, 9.6, study 009

text: perp perpetrator object list thereof. cyp_ind CYP induction data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' name perpetrator compound character. 'cyp' CYP enzyme (upper case) character. 'emax' \(E_{max}\), .e., maximum induction effect determined vitro numeric. 'ec50' \(EC_{50}\) µM numeric. 'maxc' maximal concentration µM tested vitro assay numeric. 'source' Optional source information character.

title: Basic static CYP induction risk — static_cyp_induction_risk
text: data frame.

title: Basic static CYP induction risk — static_cyp_induction_risk
text: basic (EMA) fold-change (FDA) methods evaluate whether maximal fold-change mRNA expression > 2-fold expected unbound hepatic concentration drug. Regarding relevant drug concentrations, FDA guidance suggests considering \(30*I_{max,ss,u}\) EMA guidance considers \(50*I_{max,ss,u}\) hepatic \(0.1*I_{gut}\) intestinal CYP enzyme induction. expected concentrations respective vitro assays cover concentrations.

title: Drug transporter inhibition risk — transporter_inhibition_risk
text: perp perpetrator object. transporter_inh Transporter inhibition data data frame. following fields expected: 'name' perpetrator compound name 'cyp' UGT enzyme (upper case) character. 'ic50' \(IC_{50}\) inhibition μM. 'source' Optional source information character. transporter_ref Transporter reference data.

title: Drug transporter inhibition risk — transporter_inhibition_risk
text: data frame.

title: Drug transporter inhibition risk — transporter_inhibition_risk
text: relevant metric assessment transporter interactions \(R=[]/K_i\). vitro transporter inhibition studies, \(IC_{50}\) values experimentally determined. Since transporter substrate concentration usually kept low relation \(K_m\) minimize passive permeation, \(K_i = IC_{50}\) can assumed. relevant perpetrator concentrations \([]\) : \(I_{gut}\) intestinal P-gp BRCR \(I_{max,inlet,u}\) hepatic basolateral transporters OCT1, OATP1B1 OATP1B3 \(I_{max,ss,u}\) renal basolateral transporters OAT1, OAT3 OCT2, well apical transporters outside intestinal mucosa, .e., hepatic P-gp BCRP, MATE1, MATE2-k. Note FDA EMA guidelines differ definitions thresholds assumed clinically relevant effects.
